name: Satchel of Shinier Bait
entries: A small pouch containing Morenstar Lake's new special Shinier Bait, a glimmering gem-like item that has little value by itself, but is easily confused as valuable to the casual observer.

As a bonus action, a creature can remove one piece of bait and throw it up to 30 feet away. Alternatively, they can use their bonus action to attach it to a piece of ammunition, due to the Shinier Bait's higher durability.

If it lands within 30 feet of another creature, that creature must make a DC15 Wisdom saving throw at the start of their next turn. Beasts have disadvantage on this saving throw. On a fail, they must move up to their speed towards the bait and pick it up. The creature is not compelled to move in a way that obviously endangers them; for instance, over a cliff or through a known hazard. If the creature picks it up, succeeds on their saving throw, or if the bait is unreachable, they immediately discern it as a worthless item and are immune to this effect until the next dawn.
The bag contains up to 5 pieces of bait. {@dice 1d4+1} pieces of bait reappear in the bag each day at dawn.
